info.content:
In the morning Mummy took Sunday school at church. Daddy computer programmed.

It was so hot. We all had a turn in the paddling pool. Daddy and Ben went to Banger car racing at Aldershot. The bangers weren't great as there were no crashes. However, they enjoyed the hot rods and superstox.

Ben and Hot Rod

The two of them were gripped to the cricket. The most amazing finish to a test match. England won.

We went around to see Great Grandma who had also been watching the cricket. She was in fine form.

Great Grandma visit

In the evening we all sat down and watch Bohemian Rhapsody on DVD.

title.value: Church, Banger Racing, Ashes, Grandma, Bo Rhap

info.content:
The Dolton's left after breakfast for their trip down the south west. Hattie and Betsy woke early and wanted to wake us 3 up. They did! Those two do not seem to run out of energy.

Despite Jessica feeling a little under the weather she let Daddy know that she wanted to parkrun. So her and Daddy trotted off to Frimley Lodge to do the 5km jog in hot conditions. They did it in 39:22 minutes.

Meanwhile Ben and Mummy went down to Auntie Charlotte's to help spring clean her house. They were rewarded with a Subway and Ben had a Shakeaway too.

In the afternoon Daddy went off to watch Chertsey beat Erith and Bevedere in the FA Cup. He watched it with Graham mainly. They were laughing at all the banter the 'behind the goal' crowd were dishing out. There was a great atmosphere there.

In the evening Katie went out with friends again to the cinema and for something to eat.

Mummy and Daddy went to Camberley cricket club for Susan Harvey's 50th birthday party. Mummy almost mixed in. They were there for 2 hours.

title.value: parkrun with Jessica, Ben and Mummy help Charlotte clean. CTFC. Susan Harvey's 50th, Katie out in Camberley

info.content:
Mummy's cousin Kerry was en-route to her holiday with the family in Devon. They used us for an overnight stop.

The girls

title.value: Doltons over for BBQ and to stay the night

info.content:
Despite the late night, we arose early, eager to find out Katie's results. We dropped her in to school for 9am. She opened with Catherine and was very pleased with the results.

  • Mathematics: 5
  • English Language: 5
  • Science: 5 5 (double award)
  • English Literature: 4
  • History: 6
  • French: 3
  • Photography: 5
  • Religious Studies: 5
  • Child Care: B

For the uneducated.:

  • 6 is equivalent to a B (a good pass)
  • 5 is equivalent to a C+ (a pass)
  • 4 is equivalent to a C (the lowest pass)
  • 3 is equivalent to a D (just failed)

We are all very pleased with the results. It means Katie can do the courses at Farnborough that she wants to do. We knew French would be a fail. Katie thought she'd get a better mark in English Literature, but didn't think she do as well in History. Well done Katie we're all very proud.

Katie's GCSE results

During the day we had Fiona, Tom, Natasha, Helen and Guy over to play. It was nice to catch-up. Ben, Katie and Tom biked to Farnborough for a McD's. The rest of us went to the recreation park and played on the swings. Guy liked Daddy!

Playing over at the Rec

It was Farfar's 73rd birthday. Daddy visited him during the day and went out for an Italian meal in Odiham in the evening with the Tremear's and the Fars. Farfar had a nice night. He drank a bit!

title.value: Katie GCSE Results, Burrows and Morleys Over, Farfar 73rd Birthday

info.content:
Daddy went for another run, this time to see his Cavaion Veronese municipal building that can be seen for miles around and one he always pointed out.

Route

We met with the airbnb lady who was satisfied with how we left the place and we moved on to Milan for a mooch about. We had a picnic on some patch of grass to the west of the city. The girls went shopping in the CityLife mall. The boys took a city bike and cycled to the San Siro football stadium. They looked around the shop and moved on to the horse race track behind. The boys got told off for biking inside the grounds! They stopped for a drink at McD's. The girls bought some holiday presents.

Route

San Siro

We met up and drove the long way around into the centre of Milan. It was surprisingly empty. Not much traffic on the roads and not too many people about. Strange. We parked right by Sforzesco Castle and took a tour around. It was pretty hot. We sat by the fountains and walked down one of the pedestrian, shopping streets. Looking at the time we returned back to the car and headed north in the direction of the airport. We stopped for some lunch, filled the car with petrol and thankfully handed the car back without any incidents!

Fountains in front of Sforzesco Castle

Milan City Centre Wander

We took off 20 minutes late, last flight of the day. We got out of Gatwick relatively quickly and made it home for 1am!

Overall the holiday cost us about £3000. We had a lovely time and really recommend Lake Garda for families and old people.

title.value: Italy Holiday Day 8 - Milan

info.content:
We ventured 20 minutes down the road to Caneva Aquapark. We arrived before it opened so we could rush into get to the big rides before the crowds arrive. Jessica and Ben headed for the Stuka Boom, a terrifying slide where you stand in a capsule, the operator presses a button, the floor is removed and you free fall vertically down the slide! Ben went 5 times, Jessica 2, Daddy 1 and Katie was very brave as she went in the capsule, lost her nerve, got out, then returned 2 minutes later to do the slide. The queues were relatively short for the first 90 minutes. Next up was a double rubber dinghy near vertical drop. It was terrifying for Daddy. Loved it. However, Daddy's favourite ride was the 'Superman Slide'. You go down a modest, ski jump style slide with a rolled mat in front, then launch off in a superman pose and land 5 to 10 metres from the slide. It feels as if you are flying. We did the Crazy River which had loads of whirl pools. It was good fun and even Mummy joined in on this one... despite wanting to get down as quick as possible. Ben did all the slides, even the kiddy ones. That's his thing. Mummy's favourite slide was the 5 way race straight slide, Ben's the Stuka, Jessa's and Katie's the double dinghy vertical slide. Overall we rated this water park. Loved it.

The Stuka drop slide

After we got home, ate dinner, strangely went into the swimming pool and started to pack for our exit tomorrow.

title.value: Italy Holiday Day 7 - Caneva Aquapark

info.content:
Daddy went for a morning 11km run around Bardolino and Cisano. It was hot even at 8am... and the hills were savage. When he returned he woke the rest of us up. Our intention was to visit Sirmione. There was bad traffic getting there... and even worse on the peninsula. We turned around and went back to Laguna where Daddy had spotted pedalo boats with slides attached. This was a Gay winner. We paid our 12 euros for the hour of fun. We had the usual Ben attempting to rock the boat over and mummy trying really hard at pedaling. We had a great time. Mummy spotted a lazy, floating chair. She hired it and read her book out on the lake. Her idea of heaven. Ben and even Daddy also had a go. It was very relaxing. We had a bit of a scare as we thought Katie was going to the toilet. 45 minutes later she turned up having gone to the shops. We were worried for her whereabouts. Very pleased to see her. She only did it to get lots of cuddles!

Route

Mummy relaxing on Laguna beach

We had enough by late afternoon and made our way north up to Garda. We walked about the town. However, our main purpose of the visit was to go to the restaurant that the Maisey's recommended, Burscolli. We were a bit early at 6pm... the only ones to begin with that were eating. We thought we all got the Aperol Spritzer for a starter, instead it was a ginger beer alternative. Mummy ordered the real deal and she loved it. We all ordered different stuff. It was too much. Daddy the dustbin ate both Jessica's and Ben's left overs! For pudding we got a complimentary gelato and the adults got an ice cold Lemoncello.... which warms the heart. We finished wandering the streets of Garda with a big gelato. Not as big as our Bardolino, enjoyable nonetheless.

Garda

Garda again

title.value: Italy Holiday Day 6 - Laguna, Garda

info.content:
We felt we deserved a lie in this morning so got up a little later. We left the apartment with no breakfast or picnic packed, so first stop was the crowded supermarket in Lazise. This shop wasn't doing Mummy's anxiety any good. We escaped with food. Close by was Cola. We escaped the parking fees and went down a random resendtial street to dump the car. We entered into this paradise place. The lawns were cut fine, the trees looking mature and well kept and then the main event of two thermal spa lakes.... with some fun bits. Jessica I swear never left the lakes. The water was nice and warm. It wasn't crowded either. We played games like British Bulldog. We spent most of the day there... until it was dinner time. Another trip to the supermarket and dinner back at the apartment before heading off for part 2 at the Thermal Spas. Daddy negotiated our way in because we didn't have tickets to get back in. It was lovely. We played more games, and enjoyed the lights coming on when it got dark. We stayed till about 9pm.

Thermal Spas

title.value: Italy Holiday Day 5 - Thermal Spas, Cola

info.content:
Daddy made us get up at 6:45.... on a weekend, on holiday! Reason: parkrun in Padova, 80 minutes away. We stopped off at a nearby McDonalds for freshly squeezed orange juice (we saw them put the oranges in) and croissants. We got to parkrun 1 minute before Ben and Daddy set off. The rest of us cheered them past, twice each lap. There were 4 laps. The weather was again hot even at that time of the morning. Ben raced off and left Daddy in his dust. Ben was 5th until the 4th lap where he struggled. Still he finished 8th out of 30 something runners. We got our parkrun pics and said our thanks to the Italian organizers.... only two of them for the whole event. We got melon and water after. Splendid.

Route

Padova parkrun

We then drove into Padova a little more. Daddy had scouted Google Maps beforehand to find free parking spaces near the railway station. Bingo. We walked to the station, bought tickets for £30 return and got on the double decker train. Unfortunately no seats.

We rolled into the Venice St Lucia and walked out into a wonderful, sunny, busy setting. There were porters wheeling suitcases, lots of people going into and out of the station, people selling stuff and a great looking bridge over the grand canal.

Just outside the station

Grand Canal

More canal shots

Gondola street

We began walking through the quaint, 'cute', streets. We were loving the stylish, colourful, old, almost run down looking buildings. There were a lot of fellow tourists. We made our way to the main sites. We needed the toilet and paid 7.50 euros for the privilege! We reached the most impressive, but overcrowded Rialto bridge before finding a great spot for lunch. It was a path ended via a small canal with streams of Gondolas going down it. We dangled our legs in to the water (later found out this is against the laws) and ate our picnic. We bought some not so cheap sweets in the candy store. There were many shops and restaurants lining our path. Sure they were a tad more than England, but not the extortionate rates we were led to believe.

Rialto Bridge

The famous St Marks square. We were suffering a bit in the sun, so walked around the perimeter where there was shelter. The shops looked a little run down to be honest. Again not eye wateringly expensive. We looked up the prie of a Gondola. 80 euros for half an hour. We weren't 100% sure if that was each person or a boat load. We suspect the later. We headed east along the waters edge. Jessica wasn't too happy of the amount of endless waking in the crowds and heat. Once you've seen one canal you've seen them all, was her attitude. We came up with a plan to appease her.

St. Marks Square

We headed north where eventually there were no crowds, off the beaten track one might say. We saw derelict buildings even. It was nice to see the non-tourist parts of the city. It is a lot larger than we'd appreciated. We got to the north coast part and caught the water bus (37.5 euros) in a clockwise direction. We were seeing Venice by boat... for an hour. We reached the train station. Daddy, Ben and Katie went on a couple more stops and walked back. We got a fridge magnet and some liquid refreshments.

Route

Siblings got on very well

The returning train was just as packed. However, we managed to get some seats this time, albeit Ben having to sit on Daddy's lap. We returned back to the apartment, had a swim, dinner, another swim and played cards on the balcony until the light deemed end of play.

title.value: Italy Holiday 4 - Padova parkrun, Venice

info.content:
We woke via the alarm and had breakfast before getting out a little after 9am. We were off to Gardaland which was the local theme park. Daddy doesn't really enjoy queuing on a baking hot day. Instead he would fry himself on a 90km ride in the countryside to the south of Lake Garda. He managed to get a suggested local route. Of course he got lost and added bits here and there. Otherwise it was a lovely trek through some old Italian villages. He saw many fruit bushes/trees including grapes of course, apples, cherries and what looked like kiwi!

Route

Daddy cycling. Cavriana

Meanwhile the rest of us were dropped off at the gates and we went and wandered around the park. Jessica's and Mummy's favourite ride was tidal wave, Katie's was Oblivion and Ben's was a rollercoaster that was quite smooth and did loop the loop.

Moo Moo and Katie at Gardaland

We finished up at 6:15 went home to freshen up and then straight back out to our lovely Bardolino. We went into the Bardolino Pizzeria to have, erm, Pizza. They offered some free drinks. For the adults it was Aperol Spritzer. It looked like Lucozade. The pizzas were large enough for even the hungriest of mouths. We weren't too adventurous between us. We took a doggy bag home! The final offering was some Lemoncello and some licquorise liqueur. Even Katie had a shot! 55 Euros, can't be bad.

Pizzaria

We returned back to the apartment by 9pm and had a final play in the swimming pool. Earlish night as we have a longer day tomorrow.

title.value: Italy Holiday 3 - Gardaland, Daddy Bike Ride

info.content:
We started late. Daddy went out to get breakfast. A small box of Cornflakes, 5 bread rolls and 4 toilet rolls. 8 euros. 8 flipping euros. Daddy wouldn't let that rest. Anyway we had breakfast and was planning a day circling the lake. However, the bank holiday and bad traffic meant a change of plans. Verona it was. It was about 45 minutes along the motorway. We parked up in a proper multi story (12 euros) and walked to the Arena. A roman amphitheater. Looked very impressive. Adjacent was a building that was recognizable. It's a picture that's been in the Fars hallway for decades.

We caught the land train which took us around the beautiful city in 25 minutes. We saw so many classical Italian narrow streets, big old churches, castles, bridges and markets.

We had our picnic back at the amphitheater, Piazza Bra, before heading into the pedestrian streets. It was designer makeup shops and posh boutiques all the way. Eventually we got to the market square of Piazza Erbe. Katie and Jess had a fantastic cocktail of fruits (4 euros each). Looked refreshing, especially in the heat, if a tad expensive. We meandered to S Anastasia, returned past Romeo's house and onto Juliet's balcony. It was packed full of tourists. We got the obligatory photos and headed back to the main square. Daddy tried to hire some bikes for us, without success so we hopped in the car and went back to the apartment.

Route

Juliet with 2 pretty girls

Juliet's balcony

Piazza Erbe

Jessica Furit Pot

Verona

I Love You Verona

We had bought a jet ski inflatable so gave that a go in the swimming pool. Mummy cooked up burgers and sausages before we headed out again to another local town of Lazise. Another walled, picturesque town. It had plenty of life, loads of people milling about or in the restaurants. Jessica had another fruit cocktail thing. We loved walking on the promenade and another spectacular sunset over the alps. More gelatos. Mummy and Daddy's favourite is now the limone, Ben and Katie love the Kinder Beuno flavour.

It was dark when we got back. We all went out for another dip in the pool. We had it to ourselves. Lovely view of all the lights around Lake Garda.

Sailing Boat on Garda sunset

Lazise Promenade

title.value: Italy Holiday 2 - Verona, Lazise

info.content:
It was a 3am alarm call for the Gay's who were off to Gatwick. Performing their normal 'some random housing estate in Horley, parking trick' they caught the bus and monorail to the north terminal. Everything going smoothly, well just the hiccup of an overweight bag. The plane left late, arrived at Milan on time and then the fun and games of getting the car. A few laps around terminal 2 before realizing we needed terminal 1. Fortunately Jessica saw the sign for the shuttle bus across. The weather was good, 26 degrees.

We were amazed at the car Daddy got. It was almost normal and non-cheapskatey. We had a two hour journey in the Alfa Guilliet, eastwards to Cola where we picked up the keys to the apartment. The accommodation was pretty basic, off the beaten track and compact. However, it had a lovely view of the lake and had a shared swimming pool..... which we made use of straight away. We even tested our new under water camera.... and it wasn't an iPhone!

We later headed out to Lidl and got in some supplies. We bought pizza, then realized we didn't even have an oven!

A pasta dinner, another splash in the pool and then we decided to visit our local town, Bardolino, a mile and half away. Daddy made us do a walk. A beautiful walk that took in the quaint, narrow streets of shops and the water's edge. The sun was setting over the Alps which made for some stunning views. We continued on the edge of Lake Garda. Everyone was eating gelato. So we dipped in too. It was the nicest, best value ice cream we've ever had. We trundled through the streets, got some tat in the tourist shop before heading back to the apartment. A third and final swim with all the fairy lights on was great. 19 hour day.

Route

Piggy backing in Bardolino

Looking onto Lake Garda and the Alps

title.value: Italy Holiday 1 - Flights, Bardolino

info.content:
Jessica imposed a challenge on herself not to enter the house for 24 hours. She ate and slept outdoors from 9 in the morning. Mental

Jessica sleeping on the trampo

Daddy competed in the Hart4 running event with the Frimley Flyers. 4 in a team, relay, 4km laps in 4 hours. Daddy was pleased with his times.

Lap 1 - RouteLap 2 - RouteLap 3 - Route

Hart4

title.value: Jessica - 24 Hour camp out challenge, Hart4

info.content:
Ben left yesterday for a long weekend down in Hayling Island with Ma Ma who had organised to go with an autistic child and Joey. The boys were very good with the other boy.

Meanwhile the rest of us got up early and headed to Old Deer Park where Daddy did a blustery parkrun.

Route

Jessica and Katie were not the most delighted at the next walk. A wander around Kew Gardens. We first headed to the impressive pagoda and climbed to the top. We could see right into London. Katie reckoned she could see the London Eye. Daddy wasn't convinced! We went around the Temperate greenhouse and then the tree top walk.After a picnic we ventured over to the other side of the grounds. The children went in to the adventure playground, whilst the adults went into the palace. Mummy is getting more and more interested in these type of places. It is where King George III and his family lived. The final stopping point was the Palm Greenhouse. Mummy and Daddy tried to recreate a photo from 21 years ago..... but I think failed.

Route

Some glass sculpture thing

Temperate House

Inside one of the greenhouses

Just Mummy and Daddy

In the afternoon the girls went into Camberley to get Summer a birthday present. Mummy was called to go to Hayling Island to help look after Ma Ma.

Joey and Ben climbing

title.value: Old Deer Parkrun, Kew Gardens, Ben in Hayling Island

info.content:
The Fars came over to pickup Ben and Katie and trained it to London. They splashed out on a black cab in an attempt to get the connecting train at St Pancras. Alas, it was in vein. With time to kill till the next train, Ben found his way into McDonalds!

They eventually got down to Dover Castle. They toured the castle itself as well as the WWII tunnels in the cliffs.

Ben at Dover Castle

Returning to London they went to Pizza Hut for dinner, then onward to home by about 10pm. A lovely day had by all.

Meanwhile Jess went over to the Elders. She had a lovely walk up the zig-zag in Selborne.

title.value: Ben and Katie to Dover with Fars. Jessica zig zag in Selborne

info.content:
Ben and Joey went paddle boarding

Ben and Joey paddle boarding

Katie went with Jessica shopping in Camberley for secondary school clothing and equipment.

title.value: Ben Paddle boarding

info.content:
Joey came over and went with Katie and Ben into Camberley. They bought some funny things.

In the evening Ben and Joey played in the paddling pool with Daddy, went to see Great Grandma before playing cricket and watching Gavin and Stacey.

The New Look

title.value: Joey over

info.content:
Ben is 14 today! Started as usual with breakfast in Mummy and Daddy's bed and the opening of presents. Well I say presents. Cash!

Ben decided to go to London for the day shopping. I think he's turned female! The Fars came over to pick him and Katie up and dropped them off at Gunnersbury.

There, the two caught the overground train to Stratford, which took about an hour. This was the first time the two of them have been trusted to travel so far away from home. Stratford is the destination of a massive shopping mall, Westfield.

It's so nice that brother and sister get on so well with each other they want to spend their special day with one another. They lunched at KFC and Subway. Before returning home they had spent over £100 on clothing.

In the evening we had family around to celebrate. This time we done pizzas for everyone. We had the usual fun with the paddling pool.

Ben having been dropped in the pool

A reluctant 14 year old

title.value: Ben's 14th Birthday

info.content:
Katie, Ben, Jesisca and Dan went over to Guildford to play on the crazy golf. We had a good time.

Katie went to another house party with Dan and Catherine. She had a good time, but was glad she didn't stay over.

title.value: Crazy Golf Guildford, Katie out at party

info.content:
In the morning Daddy had a crazy early start to get over to James and Emma's and then over to South East London to do Hilly Fields parkrun.

The rest of us had a lay in after such a late night.

title.value: Hilly Fields parkrun, Recovery

info.content:
We popped down to Sherringham again, came back and spent some time down at the pool. The Elders went to Bewilderwood where we traveled to back in August 2012.

In the late afternoon Ma Ma had another seizure. She was garbling her words and couldn't take instruction. An ambulance was called and was taken to hospital in Norwich. She was there for a couple of hours before being discharged.

We thought Ma Ma needed to get home really, so we packed up in the dark and headed off home at 10:30pm! We didn't get home till 3:30am!

We all thought this was the best camping holiday we've had. Mainly because of the friends we made on the campsite.

title.value: Norfolk Camping - Sherringham

info.content:
We headed off to nearby Cromer. Jessica and Toby went on some spinny bumpber cars. We then went on to the pier and enjoyed looking around the lifeboat station. We loved looking at all of the crabs being caught off the pier. Unfortunately we didn't have the kit to join in. Pop had a crab sandwich, no one else was brave enough. We went on to the stony beach and climbed on the structures.

When we got back from Cromer we followed one of the campsite trails to Sherringham Steam Train station and had an ice cream in the station cafe. It was like going back in time by 70 years!

Lily and Ben at Cromer

Mummy attempting to go down ramp

Daddy started his new job in Woking town centre, for Reach Contact. They are a Field Marketing company with thousands of employees. Their product aid representatives who basically go around supermarkets checking products are selling right and promote products. Each visit to the supermarket has set questions the field operative need to answer and tasks to carry out. Daddy needs to help develop the software that drives this. He will be working with Azure Functions, Azure Databus, Cosmos DB, GraphQL as well as a host of other admin type applications.

So far it take there is some adjustments that Daddy has to make. the environment seems a little more rigid, but there again anywhere else would be compared to his last company.

Daddy in his new offices

title.value: Norfolk Camping - Cromer, Daddy starts new job at Reach Contact

info.content:
The weather was terrible so in the morning we headed to Norwich and watched either the new Lion King or Horrible Histories at the cinema.

In the afternoon Ellie beat Ben. Ma Ma and Toby at crazy golf whilst the rest of us looked around the city centre shops. We had a BBQ for dinner back the campsite.

title.value: Norfolk Camping - Norwich

info.content:
In the morning we tackled the assault course and trim trail and went in the pool. We then drove to Sherringham and looked around the town. There was an amazing ice cream and sweet shop.

Off on our bikes to Sherringham

Daddy first went to the bike shop to get a new tyre and a couple of new inner tubes. Then he set off through Malvern and up to Elgar's place where he had stopped yesterday. It began raining as he pedaled through Worcester and out the other side heading south-east. He followed the 442 cycle route to Pershore where he was to meet the Fars. It was raining very hard and no specific time was set. Daddy couldn't get hold of the Fars by phone and so began to worry. Thankfully they eventually met up and headed home.

Setting off from the hotel in Malvern

Route

title.value: Norfolk Camping - Sherringham, Biking - Malvern to Pershore

info.content:
We went over to the beach at Hunstanton. It was a really hot day. We need to get into the sea as it was so hot. We had the inflatables in there and went shell hunting and played boules on the beach.

In the evening we had fish and chips on the beach.

Playing boules on the beach

Daddy's day didn't quite go according to plan. He initially scaled back his distances and started from the border town of Knighton (just inside Wales). The Fars were a little late for the first stop in Leominster and then he went along the wrong road and then got 3 punctures! Fortunately international rescue was at hand!

Up the hill we go

Route

International Rescue

title.value: Norfolk Camping - Hunstanton, Biking - Knighton to Worcester

info.content:
The Dolton family came up to visit us today. We headed to the Hillside Animal Sanctuary, 5 miles north of Norwich. Hattie said Jessica was her best friend and they liked looking at the animals together.

In the evening the children went over to the cricket field and made some friends. There was Ben and Euris. They spent most evenings together whilst the adults played Rummikub and the most painful version of Code Names with Ma Ma and Pop Pop.

Animal Sanctuary with Doltons

Thumbs up for Katie and Lily

Meanwhile Daddy went off for a few days with the Fars over to Malvern. He decided he would bike from Swindon to Great Malvern over the hill! He went via Kemble, source of the River Thames, Gloucester and Ledbury.

Biking through Kemble

Route

title.value: Norfolk Camping - Hillside Animal Sanctuary, Biking - Swindon to Malvern

info.content: This year we decided to go to a campsite near Cromer. It was a place called Kelling Heath. It had it's own swimming pool and evening entertainment. Along with us, Ellie, Joey, Toby, Lily, Charlotte, Ma Ma and Pop Pop all came too.

title.value: Norfolk Camping - Setting up

info.content:
Daddy's moving jobs and it was his last day in the office at Highlight. Almost 6 years service. He had carried on for 2 months, since handing his notice, giving full commitment. It was only yesterday did he start to ramp down. They have been so kind. His boss Martin and friend Mia always checking up on his blood sugars..... more than us lot at home! He'd gone out to lunch with a couple of close friends during the week. In the afternoon everyone in the office congregated and gave Daddy a nice leaving card.

In the evening he had a leaving do in Guildford. Starting at Turtle Bay, where they enjoyed the 2 for 1 cocktail offer. Daddy had a Mojito, 2xUB40's, a Guilty Pleasure, Tea, rum and coke and a bottle of lager. It was nice to see an array of faces (past and present), although not many from the development team. Unsociable lot. The Fars came to pick him up as he missed the last train home!

Daddy will definitely miss Anthony, Martin and Mia. Hopefully he'll meet with them again soon.

Leaving drinks at Turtle Bay

Leaving card

title.value: Daddy's Last Day at Highlight

info.content:
Our big girl turned 16 today. Wow. We started in normal fashion. In Mummy and Daddy's bedroom with a nice fruit breakfast and presents. Jessica's friend, Amerit stayed over so she got involved too.

In bed opening presents

Katie was given a lot of money. By the end of the day it totaled nearly £400.

It was a baking hot day and we gave Katie three envelopes to decide what she wanted to do during the day. Either: Visit a prison in Shepton Mallet (2 hours away). Go to a sandy beach, West Wittering, or visit Brighton. As much as she wanted to visit prison, because she has a fascination with them, the long car journey in the heat put her off. Instead she chose Brighton.

We headed down there, parked up and got a bus into the city centre. We walked the lanes. First south and curled up to the previously unexplored North Lanes. We stopped off for a lovely Shakeaway. A Gay favourite watering hole. After a bit of mooching around the shops we headed to the sea front by the old burnt out pier. Katie and Ben went on the i360. It's a platform that rises high into the sky where you can get stunning views of the surrounding area. Jessica didn't fancy it.

The Lanes, Brighton

Brighton Beach

i360

After, we all got in the water. The waves were crashing in and knocking us over. The water was so warm too. No getting cold. We spent a fair bit of time in there. However, we needed to get back home so trundled back to the bus stop and home.

In the evening we'd invited the close family over for a BBQ. More presents and a happy birthday sing song.

The Elders stayed over. Not in the tent as originally planned. Joey stayed on for a couple of days. He and Ben get on ever so well.

Katie said she had a lovely day.

Evening BBQ and more presents

title.value: Katie's 16th Birthday. Brighton and Family BBQ

info.content:
Whilst the rest of us were clearing up and taxing people back to their homes, Katie went off paint balling with Dan and his friends. She had a good time, despite having no sleep.

She came back in the afternoon and fell asleep almost straight away.

In the evening we had a family game of Cluedo.

title.value: Katie Paint balling with Dan and friends

info.content:
Katie had organised a party to be held at our house. Number of guests were unknown because Katie kind of said yes to everyone! Strangely enough only Catherine from her 'Prom' friends were going to come. New friends were coming. A little worrying for Mummy and Daddy. Ohh and it involved a sleepover for a few of the party go-ers.

We setup the back-garden, moving the paddling pool away, erected a 4.5m2 gazebo, put sofas out, got a fire pit, a limited amount of alcohol and decorated with 200m of fairy lights!

The first party people go in at 5:30pm, with most people arriving at about 7pm. Music was playing, drinks were flowing and everyone having a good time. By 9pm we had our first teenager being unwell in the toilets! Things went pretty much well. Mummy had Karen Teale over and they played Ticket To Ride in the kitchen. Most of the friends were very friendly and came and spoke with the adults. Many were a little worse for wear due to drink.

11:30pm and it was music off and time for people to go home. They weren't going home! Surprised at how many parents didn't seem to know the whereabouts of their children. Many of the comebacks were 'Katie said we could stay over'. Out of the 32 or so guests, only about 15 went home.

The 15-20 who stayed did not go to bed at all and stayed up all night. Some lit the fire pit, a large majority went down to McDonalds to get more food and goodness knows what hour of the day.

In the morning, it was a struggle to get people moving out, even after Katie had disappeared for the day. Katie went off with Dan paint balling after no sleep!

The party was deemed a success. Katie's friends remarked they had a great time and she should do it again! The only damage really was to the trampoline. The netting got ripped, I think as a result of about 10 of them being on there at the same time. Hoping Ben and Jessica don't have anything similar!

Early doors in the back garden

title.value: Katie's 16th Birthday House Party

info.content:
Katie had announced that she has got her first official boyfriend, Dan. He's a school friend who lives up in Deepcut. He's a very friendly chap.

Katie over the past 2 weeks has been on mini dates with: Giles, Kye, Henry I, Henry II, Henry III, Hadyn and George.

Katie and Dan

title.value: Katie's First Boyfriend - Dan

info.content:
We started off with breakfast in the hotel before departing at about 9:30. We got off the main road quickly and headed south. Again we feared Jessica's early progress through some shrubbery (nettles and prickles). After a bit of encouragement she got on her bike and we rolled along the nice New Forest roads. We eventually hit the Forest section which was a good 10 miles long. In the middle was Burley where we stopped off for lunch and some sweets.

New Forest action

Burley Sweet Shop Raid

We were due to meet with Charlotte. It was hard to give a time when we would hit Bournemouth. Some moments were quick downhills, others we were struggling across a cow field! We met a few New Forest ponies along the way. Amazing animals. Of course there were times where the party music blared out. Jessica was a lot better today. It way Mummy who was the one at the back more often than not.

Long, straight New Forest tracks

The ladies

We hit the coast in Christchurch and rode along the cliff top all the way to Bournemouth Pier. Charlotte and Lenny were waiting for us there. Another 31 miles done. Well done all.

Bournemouth Pier

Route

We headed off to a much deserved Shakeaway. Our favourite drink. Ben had a 'Dave', Ferrero Rocher and Kinder Bueno with Flake, Daddy an Omar; blackberries and blueberries, Jess an 'Ava'; strawberries and raspberries. They tasted soooo good. We said our goodbyes to Charlie and Lenny and headed to the railway station. £55 in all for rail tickets in a packed train.

We rushed home to watch the end of the amazing World Cup Cricket Final which England won. Ben was hopping around the room not knowing what to do with himself it was so tense.

title.value: New Forest Bike Ride 2 - Ower to Bournemouth

info.content:
The annual Gay family bike ride saw us continue our journey from two years ago. Then, we had travelled from Windsor to Winchester. This year we decided to go from Winchester to Bournemouth. The first problem was: Daddy going to miss parkrun, and two how were we to start in Winchester? Daddy made the rule that if we were not ready by 8:45 he'd do parkrun. Thankfully we did just do that. Mummy and Katie rode to Farnborough station and caught the train. The other three drove down, carefully balancing 3 bikes on the back of the car.

We all met at Winchester cathedral, the end location of the ride 2 years ago and headed off. Maybe not the smartest of start locations, as for the first mile or two it was uphill. Already Mummy got off the bike to walk and Jessica wasn't in great shapes mentally! It was going to be a long day.

Starting at Winchester Cathedral

We soon got out into the quiet country roads where everything calmed down. The music was on and it was a party atmosphere. Well for some of it. Jessica had big mood swings. One moment she was biking ahead showing off how fast she was..... the next she was barely moving which made it frustrating for others. We stopped off at a couple of pubs for lunch and refreshments. Ben was worrying us all with his perpetual 'look at me, no hands' antics which scared the living daylights out of mummy.

Mummy and Jessica riding by

Rest point. Only 10 miles to go

We got to within a couple of miles of the hotel, very close to Paulton's Park. Ryedown Lane was a long, quite steep at the end, incline. We had ridden 30 miles by this point. Jessica, with the help of her siblings raced up the hill. Amazing. Mummy walked it.

We reached the Premier Inn, dumped our bags, collapsed and then half an hour later headed back out for some dinner.

Route

We took a 3 mile ride to the Testwood pub. Not sure anyone could really sit in their saddles because we had sore bottoms. Ben ordered a meal for two, whilst Katie had a cider! One of the bar staff came up and asked Katie for ID! Whoops. We then ventured home on a different route. We had the excitement of being accosted by some dogs which scattered the family to the four corners of Paulton! We slept well.

title.value: New Forest Bike Ride 1 - Winchester to Ower

info.content:
Today, Jessica's SATs score and school report came out. She had been struggling quite a bit this time last year. She's had a great teacher in Mrs Hannon who has helped Jessica back up. Her scores were 100, 102 and 104. 100 being average. This was a huge relief and we're all so proud of Jessica who has worked hard this year and shown she can do it. Well done Jessica.

Jessicas School Report

title.value: Jessica's SATs results

info.content:
Daddy awoke early with a egg and bacon roll and some presents. Mummy and Katie rushed back from Pop Pop's where they stayed last night. Daddy had an ordinary day at work otherwise.

Daddy's birthday dinner

After work Jessica was performing in her school play as Mr Brownlow. She had a few chunky lines to recite, which she done very well. Over the past weeks she has been rehersing and singing the songs at all sorts of times. She's been loving it. Ben was overjoyed to come and watch too.... not.

Mr Brownlow

Jessica performing

Back at home the Fars came over, more presents arrived, and we all had a game of Trivial Pursuit which Ben won. Mummy popped out to see Ma Ma in hospital.

title.value: Martin's 44th Birthday - Jessica in Oliver

info.content:
Ma Ma had a funny turn today whilst at Great Grandma's. She was incoherent and lost consciousness where Pop Pop had to give mouth to mouth. The ambulance was called and she came around. This is about the 5 time this year. Previously they have been mini-strokes, but this time it seemed a little more serious. After scans it has been diagnosed as Epilepsy. Ma Ma is taken it in her stride and almost laughing it off. It's nothing, she says. Mummy is urging her to slow down.

Katie was taken out by Giles today in Camberley. She had a nice time.

title.value: Ma Ma into hospital

info.content:
In the morning Jessica was collected from Summer's after her camping sleepover.

Meanwhile Daddy and Ben went in for the FF fun day. First up was the naked run.... no watch (not no clothes). Daddy predicted his time would be 27:00 and Ben 27:30. We had to run 5km to that time without the aid of a watch. 30 other competitors also ran to their times. Unfortunately Ben and Daddy were about 30 seconds too quick which put them down in the bottom echelons of the final positions. The winner, Christine, ran within 2 seconds of her predicted time. After, there was a BBQ and a game of rounders. Very nice.

>Meanwhile Mummy went to church and did 'scramblers', then went down with Jessica to pick up Katie and her friends from Barton On Sea. She had a good time.

FF Lineup

Ben setting off

title.value: FF Fun Day, Katie Barton On Sea pickup

info.content:
Katie still away in Christchurch with her friends.

Daddy and Ben parkrun'ed at Frimley Lodge. Ben hasn't done any training, but after last weeks run is in good form. So good, he smashed his PB by over 20 seconds. His PB is now 23:00. Ben was well pleased.

Ben 23:00 PB jumpshot

Straight after parkrun, Ben went out with his mates to Farnborough cinema to watch the new Spiderman movie. He thought it was good if a little rushed.

Mummy and Daddy had jobs to do. Daddy put up the paddling pool and balanced the old fridge freezer on top of the car and gingerly went down to the tip. What could possibly go wrong. Ha. Nothing in this instance! Mummy did some work in the front garden bits.

Jessica was a bit under the weather, but decided to go to Summer's overnight camping birthday. So both girls away.

In the evening, Mummy and Daddy went over to the Barnett household. Eva had a dance production at the Hexagon, so Molly needed babysitting. She was a delight. Very enthusiastic for us to play with her. We did puzzles, games and reading of books. Daddy left after a while and cycled back home.

Route

Babysitting Molly

title.value: Ben parkrun PB. 23:00 and Spiderman, Jessica sleepover. Molly babysit. Daddy cycle from Reading

info.content:
The day after prom and Katie went down with Catherine and Maddie to Christchurch to stay in Catherine's family caravan for 3 days. Most of the time was spent on the beach.

Jessica had her sports day in which she helped run as she was on the sports council. She participated in a few races and got pipped on the line for one of them. The races were seeded. She came 4th in the fast group for 80 metres and tied first in the 200 metres.

Jessica sprint down the final straight

title.value: Katie 3 day Christchurch, Jessica Sports Day

info.content:
Six months in the making, 2 dresses, 2 sets of eyelashes, a change of cars, change of who she is going with, change, change, change. Finally all sorted and went to the prom looking so beautiful.

Mummy, Daddy, Jessica and Lily all went over to Maddie's house for a prom pre-gathering and a chance to take photos. She went with: Maddie, Amelia, Esha, Catherine, Lucy and XXX.

Uncle Graham drove 3 of the girls in his Merc to Pine Ridge where the adoring masses waited for Katie to step out. We had Karren and Evie, the whole Elder crowd, with Ma Ma, Pop Pop and Farmor supporting her.

She looked so beautiful as she stepped out and walked along the red carpet, past all the teachers and into Pine Ridge.

Katie Gay

Katie arriving in Graham's car

Katie with Esha and Catherine

title.value: Katie's School Prom

info.content:
At Tomlinscote School Mummy, Daddy and Ben went. Ben received an attainment award in Maths. The only one in his year, basically meaning he is best at Maths in his year (300+ pupils).

We are all very proud of him. He was presented his award in front of an assembly of other award winners and their parents. It lasted 90 minutes. Well done Ben.

Ben awarded top of year for Maths

title.value: Ben wins Top Of The Year for Mathmatics

info.content:
After school Daddy took Ben and Katie up on the train to Wimbledon. Katie didn't know anything about tennis or this tournament. She hadn't even heard of Wimbledon as a tennis thing! Education was required.

Having got to the station we caught a bus and walked a mile or so to car park 10 where the queue started! We got there at about 5:45. We were in the queue for about an hour and a half. There were momentary bits of entertainment, but the weather was good so we had a bit of laugh queuing. Eventually we got past airport style security and through the turnstiles at 7:15. A lady gave us her two tickets to Centre Court. The Kyle Edmund match was about to finish. However Katie and Ben went in, sat down and saw 4 games. Katie was more fascinated by the ball boys and girls and the line judges than the tennis itself. Daddy went to court 12 to see the last bits of Alize Cornet v Victoria Azarenka. And that was about the sum of all the tennis. Once those two games had finished, that was about it in terms of watching live action.

We meandered our away around to Henman Hill or Murray Mound or whatever it is called. We sat for 20 minutes or so eating strawberries, it'll be rude not to, before returning back on the bus and train home.

Costs:

  • Train £15
  • Bus £15
  • Food £15
  • Tickets £54

Despite the expense for a few games of tennis, it was totally worth it for Katie and Ben to experience what Wimbledon was like.

Tennis ball chair in the queue

Got in. Scoreboard and Centre Court

Strawberries on Henman Hill

title.value: Wimbledon Tennis

info.content:
The final day. First a chorus of birthday wishes to Ellie who was 41 today. However, it was not a glamorous occasion as we all packed away the tents and shuttled some of the cars to the end point. Young Emily loved playing with us. We took her out on the Kayak.

Early morning boat service

Prepping the launch

We eventually got away with Jessica sharing the kayak with Daddy. She recited all her lines for Oliver and sang many of the songs. Just a couple of miles up the river with the Ferryman pub where we stopped, had a coffee and changed over crew. Loz came into Daddy's boat.

We hadn't got any proper lunch, so was willing to get to the end at Godstow. The weather was decent and overcast. Not a patch on yesterday. There were a couple of stops for pee's and locks.

Jessica and Daddy heading off

The rest of us waited for Kayakers and played in the river. The crusaders reached their final Thames destination, 9 miles down river, at the Trout Inn in Godstow for a spot of lunch where everyone met up. We said our goodbyes before heading off home.

Playing in the river waiting for the kayakers

The traffic was bad on the motorway so daddy headed off at West Wycombe along the A40. However, at one of the roundabouts he clattered the curb at 30mph and punctured the tyre. Of course, we had everything in the boot of the car. Everything out. Daddy managed to change the tyre with the help of a nearby resident who was only too happy to help out. 30 minutes later we were on our way again and back home. There was a lot of unpacking and washing to be done! A very enjoyable, outdoor weekend.

Route

title.value: Kayak Thames Day 3 - Appleton to Godstow. Car puncture

info.content:
Four kayaks set off from the Tadpole Bridge at Buckland Marsh. The weather was a scorcher, over 30 degrees. Only 3 kayaks would make it to the end!

Ben was in with Loz in his Kayak, Ellie and Gerry paired up as did Richard and Jon. Katie pulled the short straw and got Daddy!

It became obvious straight away that the inflatable kayak had issues and a mind of it's own. Ben and Loz struggled to keep the thing in a straight line. Daddy hopped in with Loz, but it didn't really help. In the end Daddy and Loz were in Daddy's kayak, towing Ben and Katie who could just sit back and enjoy the ride.

Quite early on we saw a very young bat fall out of the tree into the river. It then somehow swum across the water back onto a leaf. This freaked Katie out as it came towards her. It cannot have been more than 2 inches big.

Loz and Daddy struggled to Shifford lock where we stopped and ate lunch. Katie and Ben walked 3 miles to the meeting point at the Rose Revived pub in New Bridge. They happened to gate crash a wedding as they were saying their vows... to add to this Daddy blindly shouted congratulation from the kayak! Whoops. We're sure it didn't spoil their moment.

No more dragging of the inflatable kayak and a personnel change meant Ben hopped in the kayak with Daddy. There were only a few miles left. A mile before the stop point for the day, we came across a bridge which we saw other teenagers jump off. Ben decided he wanted to give it a go.... so he did. He loved it. An adrenaline rush.

Route

Start point at Buckland Marsh

Daddy and Katie started off together

Ben and Loz start off together

Loz and Daddy dragging the teenagers along

Lunch at Shifford Lock

End leg with Daddy and Ben

We got to camp about 4-ish. Mummy and Katie headed back home as Katie had a party to go to. Daddy and Ben ran back a mile up the river back to the 'jump off' bridge. Ben had 10 go's in total. Daddy went to jump, but wasn't brave enough! He wimped out!

The party went to the Plough Inn, in Appleton for some dinner. People weren't impressed with the portion sizes or amount of time to wait for the food. However, we had all evening so it didn't really matter. The evening again was spent playing cricket, building fires and going in the river.

Seeing mummy had Katie headed off, Auntie Ellie came and slept in our tent. It wasn't a great night's sleep for any of us.

Meanwhile Katie got herself ready and headed off to Catherine's house for a house party with her friends. She had a good time and came back buzzing. They slept at home.

Katie's party go-ers

title.value: Kayak Thames Day 2 - Buckland Marsh to Appleton. Catherine's House Party

info.content:
Daddy had arranged for 14 people (Us, Ma Ma, Pop Pop, The Glidewell's, Rich and Ellie) to camp and kayak over this weekend. He booked the Barefoot campsite which was in Appleton on the River Thames close to Oxford. It was hard to find a campsite on the Thames that would answer requests or accommodate us.

We barley squeezed everything into the car and headed straight to the campsite after school. The campsite was lovely, if a little rule heavy. We setup camp, jumped into the river for a swim, had a BBQ and a camp fire and played volleyball, cricket and some cards.

We tested our camp beds out. The jury is still out on their comfortableness!

Volleyball

Fire starters

Roaring away

Beautiful sunset over the Thames and camp

title.value: Kayak Thames Day 1 - Setting up camp

info.content:
Katie went with some school friends to Thorpe Park.

Thorpe Parkers

title.value: Katie off to Thorpe Park

info.content:
Yesterday evening Daddy, Jess and Katie went to the supermarket shopping in preparation for Mummy's birthday. We awoke early to give mummy croissants and strawberries in bed. Mummy also opened her presents. From Daddy she got lots of clothes, Ben gave lots of personal vouchers, like make a cup of tea, have a hug, etc. Jessica's was funny. She had an assortment of stuff. Some of it, like makeup was half used! some of it came out of her make up bag... some of it was half eaten already! She had put a bit of thought into it though and was the most excited about Mummy's birthday. She had gin and gin glasses from Susan, some vouchers from the Fars, some clothes from Ma Ma and Pop Pop and a silver watch from her sisters.

Otherwise it was a normal working day for all of us. Mummy had puberty talks with South Camberley Infants school.

Katie returned home from an overnight stay at Ma Mas and cooked a macaroni cheese for dinner. Then a surprise trip out. We were doing so well keeping it a surprise from mummy. She tried all her tricks at getting it out of us..... then Ben said, Are we going to Poundland to get sweets beforehand. The cat was out of the bag. Anyway we enjoyed Toy Story 4. Mummy and Ben cried at the end. Mummy said she had a lovely day.

Birthday dinner

title.value: Mummy's 43rd Birthday

info.content:
A family picnic down in Littlehampton to celebrate Ma Ma's birthday. Daddy decided to bike the 50 miles from home. It took him just over 3 hours.

Route

The weather was good. We had a mass game of cricket and delved into the sea for a splash of refreshing English Channel water. After we went on the pedalo's in Oyster Pond and did a spot of crabbing before singing happy birthday to Ma Ma.

Family game of cricket

Bracing the sea

Pedalo'ing

title.value: Littlehampton

info.content:
For mummy and Katie, We woke a little earlier and walked to Montmartre where there were some cute patisseries and sweet / tourist shops and got some presents. Then we went to the Moulin Rouge and took some photos before camping out at an American Grill for lunch. We had a later afternoon flight so walked back to the apartment and prepared for our flight home.

Katie at the Moulin Rouge

Katie and Nina Paris Shopping

Overall we really enjoyed our visit with Sylvie and Nina. A lot of walking and we saw some of the nice sights.

Meanwhile Daddy, Jessica and Ben went down to parkrun with Loz. Daddy ran with Ben on lap 1 before pealing off and running lap 2 with Jessica. Ben raced around in 23 minutes and was just 20 seconds outside his PB which he was very pleased with. Jessica did well in the heat running 2.5km. Loz also posted a very good time.

parkrunners

When we got back Ben went off with his mates down the park playing football and climbing trees.

Daddy, Jessica and Loz went down the cafe with all the other parkrunners and had a nice bacon sarnie.

After saying goodbye to Loz, we went over to Crockford Bridge Farm and picked some fruit for the girls as a nice treat when they return this evening. We got raspberries, strawberries and redcurrants. We had some lovely ice cream after.

Jessica keeping close guard on the fruit

Crockford Bridge Farm

title.value: Paris Day 3 - Montmartre, parkrun, Ben out with mates, Fruit Picking

info.content:
For the holiday makers, a late start in the morning. We went into a little supermarket to get some fresh orange juice, then walked to the Louvre which was vert nice. Then walked to the Apple store to get Nina her airpods which took a while to get there. For lunch we had a crepes in a nice cafe. This prepared us for a long walk to the Champs Elyses which took ages in the boiling weather. Then did a bit of shopping in some make-up shops, designer boutiques and foot locker.... where Katie got some new trainers.

Later in the evening we had booked tickets for the Eiffel Tower. Katie thought it was very pretty to look across the views of Paris. We stayed up there for an hour. There were alot of queues from one level to another.

We then got on a train, and got lost for a bit. We got back on course and had dinner at a pizzeria before heading back to bed!

Nina and Katie at the bottom of the Eiffel Tower

Katie and Nina at the Louvre Pyramid

Nice one of Katie and Nina

Katie and Mummy at the Louvre

Meanwhile Daddy had the day off and was Bazza's date for his Dad's works do at Royal Ascot. First a walk in to Farnborough to Ant's house for pre-drinks and to pick the minibus up. We each had entry, 3 drinks, £20 and the race card. Very generous. It was an early start and Bazza was hitting the beers early. Daddy was not keeping up. In the few hours before the first race the group chilled and even met Chris off Love Island (whoever that is).

Once the racing began, small bets were won and lost. Bazza was in a right old state come the end of the evening. A good day had.

Daddy off to Ascot

Daddy and Bazza a few races in

title.value: Paris Day 2 - Eiffel Tower, Champs Elyses, Louvre, Daddy to Royal Ascot

info.content:
As a treat for completing her exams, Katie and Mummy had a short treat break to Paris for a few days with some friends.

Katie, Mummy and Sylvie had an early flight to Paris from Gatwick. They flew over and met Nina who was working at the Paris airshow for the week. Before picking Nina up from work they went to their hotel / apartment in the centre of Paris. Hotel Sainte Marie, 6 Rue De La Ville Neuve, Paris 75002. After lunch we walked to the Notre Dame which had loads of boards around it after the recent, big fire. They then looked in a flower market before heading off to pick up Nina.

They then went for cocktails. Katie had a Sex On The Beach. Nina cooked a meal when they got back to the apartment which was about 10:30.

Sylie and Mummy at the Notre Dame

title.value: Paris Day 1 - Post Exam Holiday

info.content: Katie's first week of real exams. A full on week with 6 exams. She has study leave so is effectively doing revision at home and walking in to school to do the exams. French she feels didn't go well at all. Expecting to fail this exam.

title.value: Katie's GCSEs: RE, French x2, Biology, English Literature, Chemistry

info.content:
In the afternoon us girls went to the Flower Pot pub for Pop Pop's Father's Day meal.

Endure24 pack up and go. The weather was not favourable for the final run. It turned into a bit of a mud bath.

Cousin Tree Huggers

title.value: Pop Pops Father Day Meal, Endure24

info.content:
Katie met up with Summer and went to Thorpe Park for the day.

Meanwhile Daddy went to do Didcot parkrun before heading over to Wasing Park and his 5th year at Endure24. It's a 24 hour running event where you basically run for 5 miles, wait 5 hours, then run another 5 miles, etc. Daddy had favourable start times: 1pm, 7pm, 1am, 7am. In total 20 miles + 3 miles parkrun is 23 miles! There was a bit of trouble from Pete again this year. This time the whole Alasdair, Jo thing kick off a bit.

Ben and Joey came too and they even did a lap with Daddy at 1am. They were speedy and left Daddy behind on Heartbreak Hill. Ben reminded Daddy that he beat him on more than one occasion. The 3 boys all kipped in the same tent.

Running to a PB. 41 mins

The post krew lineup shot

Family of runners

Lap 1. 41:32 PBLap 2. 45:15Lap 3. 47:47Lap 4. 46:45

title.value: Didcot parkrun, Endure24, Katie to Thorpe Park

info.content:
This week was the final week of exams. Three difficult ones. Katie particularly worried about Maths. She's doing the higher paper. Daddy sat down with her the night before to go through some questions. I am not too sure how many she could do without some form of help.

Out of the three tests this week, she felt Physics went well and the other two not so confident.

On Friday, Katie came home at lunch time having completed her final GCSE exam. Daddy made sure he worked from home. As a treat they went down the bakers and Katie could have whatever she wanted. She went for a sausage roll and a chocolate rice krispy cake! In the evening we had fish and chips!

title.value: Katie's Final GCSE Exams - Maths, Chemistry, Physics

info.content:
Continuing on with Jessica's rich vein in form of representing the school in sports, today she raced with the school over at the Aldershot Military stadium.

Jessica school athletics

As Daddy was going to be away next weekend, he was treated to a pseudo Father's Day. Jessica had made a real effort, cooking and plotting the day before. Anyway breakfast in bed was had.

Ben and Daddy went for a bike ride out of Guildford along the River Wey. It was a lovely sunny day.

Route

A lovely Sunday lunch was made by Mummy and Jessica. Lamb. Daddies fave.

Later in the afternoon Daddy really wanted to go to the Banger Racing. However, they turned up as everyone was leaving. We got there too late!

Poppy field

50th different parkrun

title.value: 50th Different parkrun, Shopping, Ma Mas

info.content:
The weather wasn't great so it was decided to hold the annual Mytchett Athletic presentation evening at the Lion Brewery in Ash. Ben did get a vote this year, but Dan, Ben H, Tom and Oli all won awards. Daddy had to give a small speech. The children were getting older and we didn't get all their attention whilst the managers were presenting.

Unfortunately, later it was learnt that 3 of the Falcons players were involved in an incident which involved them reaching over the back bar, grabbing drinks and running out to the field opposite and distributing amongst their friends. The landlord caught them on their 5th attempt. CCTV was reviewed. Parents and children were given a telling off. It's a real shame. Especially as the club are trying to forge a relationship with the pub to store football equipment.

Daddy caught a train to Guildford and met up with the huddle of Highlighters for Justin's leaving do. It was held in a strange little bar called, Tudor Antiques. You needed a code to get in, and Daddy had cocktails dispensed out of a china teapot, poured into iced tumblers!

title.value: Mytchett Presentation Evening, Justin Leaving Do

info.content:
A heavy week of exams this week, including a couple which have 2 exams in one day!

As preparation for the History exam, Daddy and Katie watched a BBC documentary on 1066. This would be useful for the Normans section on Thursday. However, the battle really didn't feature. History went ok. Biology went ok too. The History paper on the Cold War and USA inequality was a bit indifferent. Katie had answered one of three points fully. English went 'OK' and Maths was hard.

title.value: Katie's GCSEs: History x2, English x2,  Biology, Maths

info.content:
In the afternoon we left Katie at home revising. The rest of us were planning to go to Hampstead Heath, however the traffic was terrible to found a lido closer by. info.content:
Daddy's ex-work colleague Tim tempted him to go for a job at Reach. Daddy had to update his CV and get prepared for an interview. Something he was not confident with. He already had a telephone interview which went well.

The interview took place in Reach's HQ in Woking. It was a relatively short affair lasting about 2 hours. There were a lot of personality and process related questions as well as a technical test where Daddy had to write some code to iterate over a tree and count nodes.

Currently at Highlight, Daddy feels he is stagnating and in some aspects going away from what he truly loves; designing, coding and problem solving. He's been taking on more and more management type functionality like; being Scrum Master, doing interviews, picking up tasks no one else wants to do.

The new role, if successful would pure be development using Azure functions, Cosmos DB, Graph QL, Azure Databus, C#, TypeScript. All very good for the CV and a different challenge.

Daddy was let know a day later that he was successful. Now does he take it?

title.value: Job Interview at Reach Contact for Daddy

Jessica represented the school again at cricket against other girls year 6's in Surrey Heath.

title.value: Jessica School Cricket Competition

info.content:
Finally the big day came. Plenty of preparation has gone into this. It had consumed Farfar for the past month. He tried hard to get Ben to be a mascot, however, the players took that allocation up. Instead Ben and Jessica had flag waving duties to do. This was to be performed on the pitch as the players lineup before the game.

The other coup was that Farfar had invited the Chancellor of the Exchequer, Philip Hammond to the match. Farfar in fact sat next to him and explained the intricacies of the format of the day. He even told how his grandson wanted his job!

We had an early start and needed to be at the stadium at 9:00am for flag waving rehearsal. This was an excuse I think to give the children an experience. They saw the players come off the bus, visited the guts of the stadium, had a supplied lunch and were treated very well.

Being so early, Mummy and Katie went off shopping! Daddy headed off to the Bobby Moore suite in Club Wembley. It wasn't quite as grand as you'd expect. Still it was nice nonetheless.

Before the game Graham and Ben were collared for an interview which was beamed up on to the massive screens.

Pre Match interview on the big screen

The first half went in a bit of a blur. Cray Valley looked equal to Chertsey.

At half time we attempted to get Ben to see Philip Hammond. However, he was in the Royal Box where we were not allowed to go. Fortunately he was kind enough to come out and meet Ben. He said to Ben, "I hear you are after my job". He also said "There are a lot of people after my job at the moment." This made Ben's day.

Chertsey had the better of the second half, despite Cray hitting the bar on the last kick of the game! Extra time and Chertsey forged a 3-1 victory. We won the cup!

The fars got on the TV and "Chris Gay" was even mentioned in the BT Sport commentary. Post match Daddy gave an impromptu interview to BBC Radio Surrey.

This was an interview for BBC Radio Surrey. Farmor hangs around in the background for this one.

Pre Match with Susan and Graham

The Falcon's were at Heatherside for an 11am kick off against Cove, who were in a division above. We had almost a full squad. Unfortunately the goalkeeper had a nightmare, dropped catches, ball through the legs, etc. We lost 5-3.

Mummy and Jessica departed for Bournemouth with Ma Ma and Pop Pop. They met with their aunties and cousins to play crazy golf and have dinner at a burger restaurant.

Daddy, Ben and Katie went to Chertsey's biggest game ever, the FA Vase Semi Final second leg against Northwich Victoria. First leg ended 1-1. Daddy helped on the turnstile and saw in over 400 spectators, taking £2500! There were a lot of notes floating around. Katie was helping Farmor in the tea bar serving drinks and taking money. Another £20 earnt.

Alwyns Lane full

The terraces were packed. Similar to the Aldershot game some 16 years previous. Farfar reckoned there were more in attendance today. The game ended 0-0 after extra time. Penalties! It was tense, but Chertsey scored all 5 of their pens. Northwich missed one. We were through. There was a pitch invasion. Everyone was so happy. Mission accomplished. Getting to Wembley is the main achievement, the result in the final is almost incidental. We cannot wait till the 18th May now.

title.value: parkrun, Falcons lose, Chertsey Town v Northwich Victoria FA Vase Semi Final 2nd Leg, Bournemouth with Westons

info.content:
Chertsey travelled up to Northwich Victoria for the FA Vase Semi Final 1st leg. Daddy and Ben joined Farfar and trained in up to Warrington. They had some time whilst waiting for their train from Euston, so Ben weaved his persuasive magic and conned Daddy into walking to Warren Street, McDonalds whilst having a hypo! After getting jammy with the order, they had to rush back to an anxious Farfar. Of course they took a wrong turning up a no-through road just to make it a bit more interesting!

On the way up Ben and Daddy played Ticket To Ride. A taxi journey to the ground, actually owned by Witton Albion, and they all got boardroom passes.

Windy Northwich

The game itself was spoilt by the windy conditions. Chertsey took the lead, but were pegged back in the second half. An even game.

They caught the team coach back to Warrington, then the train back to Euston and home. A good day out.

title.value: Northwich Victoria v Chertsey Town. FA Vase Semi Final 1st Leg

info.content:
In the morning Daddy went to Upton Court parkrun, near Slough. He started 8 minutes late! Another tourist run chalked up.

Unusually the Falcons had an afternoon match against Joey's lot. Without playing great we won 4-1 in Alton.

Ben and Joey had to leave the game early as they had a Sky Dive experience booked in Basingstoke in an indoor centre. They had a briefing then 2 x 1 minute sessions in the wind tunnel. On the second go, they were taken to the top of a dome and then down again. Ben said it was the best experience he's had! He loved it.

Daddy motorbiked home from Ben's Sky Diving experience along the M3. A week previous Daddy managed to sustain a puncture and got it plugged. Daddy raced home at 80mph along the motorway. He felt the handling a little strange, but put it down to having a hypo. By the time he got to Hook he lost confidence a bit and slowed down. It felt like the handlebars and the rest of the bike were attached via string or Sellotape. Steering seemed weird. Just as he was coming off at junction 4, he noticed a group of lads staring at the bike. Suspicious he stopped on the hard shoulder, felt the back tyre. Completely flat and scorching hot. No wonder people were looking. How did he manage to go at 60mph on a flat down the motorway? He managed to nurse the bike back home at 15mph. The sidewall had been damaged. After taking the bike in for a new tyre, Barry said the original puncture had re-appeared as well as a new one. Lucky to stay upright!

Tyre off the rim

title.value: parkrun, Alton v Falcons, Ben Sky Dive, Puncture on motorbike at 80mph

info.content:
Daddy had a check-up recently and results have returned. Daddy was astounded at his weight gain. 84kg! So he has put himself on a diet, aiming now for 77kg.

More importantly the HbA1c result. It came out at 61mmol/mol. This was better than last year, but not that close to the recommended 49mmol/mol.

History of Hb1Ac results over the years.

  • 2013: 55
  • 2013: 76
  • 2014: 76
  • 2014: 94
  • 2015: 71
  • 2016: 70
  • 2017: 56
  • 2018: 69
  • 2019: 61

Speaking with Keith, there is a chance of getting the Libre for free after April. Daddy has also pushed for a pump with the aim to get a closed-loop system. Next step is an appointment at the hospital for this. There was some disagreement on the recommended HbA1c value. Keith reckoned it to be 59mmol/mol, not 49!

title.value: Diabetic Check-up

info.content:

Along the way, Ben rode over a broken bottle and somehow managed to avoid a puncture! The house in Lee was in good condition which was comforting to see.

At Pop Pop Pop's old house

A short distance away was Charlton Athletic. The boys both needed the toilet desperately so water the plants there!

Through Greenwich and onto Millwall who had a quatre final FA Cup game today against Brighton. As such, the ground was open and we sneaked in and even got one of the staff to take a picture of us both there, before they shut the gates firmly!

A long trek back through a quaint Dulwich and a tough Sydenham Hill. They rode past the infamous radio masts.

Route
